channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: US and Iran say they'll continue nuclear talks as both build up their military forces
item.description: The second round of U.S.-Iran talks ended with a pledge to continue talking, but both sides are ramping up their military forces.
item.content:encoded: The second round of U.S.-Iran talks ended with a pledge to continue talking, but both sides are ramping up their military forces.
item.dc:creator: Jackie Northam

item.title: Former Pentagon official on the latest talks between the US and Iran
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with former Pentagon official Dana Stroul about the latest round of Iran talks and the potential for military action.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with former Pentagon official Dana Stroul about the latest round of Iran talks and the potential for military action.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Lawsuit accuses Trump administration of erasing history and science at national parks
item.description: National Park advocates and educators have sued to stop the Trump administration from taking down park displays about slavery, Native American removal, and other ugly chapters in U.S. history.
item.content:encoded: National Park advocates and educators have sued to stop the Trump administration from taking down park displays about slavery, Native American removal, and other ugly chapters in U.S. history.
item.dc:creator: Adrian Florido

item.title: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg to face jury in landmark social media addiction trial
item.description: The case is seen as a test of social media's legal responsibility for platform design features that plaintiffs' lawyers say exacerbated mental health issues in young people.
item.content:encoded:
The case is seen as a test of social media's legal responsibility for platform design features that plaintiffs' lawyers say exacerbated mental health issues in young people.

(Image credit: Nic Coury)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: U.S. and Iran say they'll continue talks as both ramp up military forces, Paramount makes a final play for Warner Bros. Discovery, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg to testify in social media addiction trial.
item.content:encoded: U.S. and Iran say they'll continue talks as both ramp up military forces, Paramount makes a final play for Warner Bros. Discovery, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg to testify in social media addiction trial.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Mumford and Sons' frontman talks about the band's new album
item.description: NPR's A Martínez asks Mumford and Sons' frontman, Marcus Mumford, about the band's new album "Prizefighter."
item.content:encoded: NPR's A Martínez asks Mumford and Sons' frontman, Marcus Mumford, about the band's new album "Prizefighter."
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: Trump administration's efforts to extend border wall threaten Texas nature reserve
item.description: The Trump administration is moving forward on building new border wall segments in environmental and culturally sensitive areas. Local activists are pleading with Congress to stop construction.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration is moving forward on building new border wall segments in environmental and culturally sensitive areas. Local activists are pleading with Congress to stop construction.
item.dc:creator: David Martin Davies

item.title: Some immigrants detained in Maine are back in the state
item.description: ICE says agents detained more than 200 people during a few days of concentrated effort in Maine. Some of those people are now being released.
item.content:encoded: ICE says agents detained more than 200 people during a few days of concentrated effort in Maine. Some of those people are now being released.
item.dc:creator: Ari Snider

item.title: The last newspaper hawker in Paris honored with knighthood
item.description: Ali Akbar, a 73-year-old immigrant from Pakistan, has been hawking papers on the streets of Paris for the last 50 years. French President Emmanuel Macron honored him with a knighthood late last month.
item.content:encoded: Ali Akbar, a 73-year-old immigrant from Pakistan, has been hawking papers on the streets of Paris for the last 50 years. French President Emmanuel Macron honored him with a knighthood late last month.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Rosman

item.title: 6 skiers rescued after California avalanche; search continues for 9 others
item.description: Six backcountry skiers who survived an avalanche in California Tuesday have been rescued. The sheriff's office said the search for the nine remaining skiers is ongoing.
item.content:encoded: Six backcountry skiers who survived an avalanche in California Tuesday have been rescued. The sheriff's office said the search for the nine remaining skiers is ongoing.
item.dc:creator: GREG MICEK
